front:
The following is the definition of which rule?
Suppose that a procedure can be broken down into a sequence of two tasks. If there are \(n_1\) ways to do the first task and for each of these ways of doing the first task, there are \(n_2\) ways to do the second task, then there are \(n_1n_2\) ways to do the procedure.

The following is the definition of which rule?
If a task can be done either in one of \(n_1\) ways or in one of \(n_2\) ways, where none of the set of \(n_1\) ways is the same as any of the set of \(n_2\) ways, then there are \(n_1 + n_2\) ways to do the task.

The following is the definition of which rule?
If a task can be done in either \(n_1\) ways or \(n_2\) ways, then the number of ways to do the task is \(n_1+n_2\) minus the number of ways to do the task that are common to the two different ways.
Which rule is also known as the principle of inclusion-exclusion?

The following is the definition of what rule?
There are \(n/d\) ways to do a task if it can be done using a procedure that can be carried out in \(n\) ways, and for every way \(w\), exactly \(d\) of the \(n\) ways correspond to way \(w\)
What does a tree (from tree diagrams) consist of?
back: A root, a number of banrches leaving the root, and possible additional branches leaving the endpoints of other branches.

front:
The following is the definition of which principle?
If \(k\) is a positive integer and \(k + 1\) or more objects are placed into \(k\) boxes, then there is a tleast one box containing two or more objects.
Which principle is also called the Dirichlet drawer principle?

The following is the definition of which principle?
If \(N\) objects are placed into \(k\) boxes, then there is at least one box containing at least \([N/k]\) objects.
When is a sequence called strictly increasing?
back: If each term is larger than the one that precedes it

front: When is a sequence called strictly decreasing?
back: If each term is smaller than the one that precedes it.
The number of r-permutations of a set with n elements

front: What is the equation of P(n,r) if n and r are integers with \(0 \leq r \leq n\)?
What is an r-combination of elements of a set?
back: An unordered selection of r elements from the set. Thus, an r-combination is simply a subset of the set with r elements.
The number of r-combinations of a set with n distinct elements

front: The number of r-combinations of a set with n elements, where n is a nonnegative integer and r is an integer with \(0 \leq r \leq n\) equals what?
What is the difference between r-permutations and r-combinations?
back: While r-permutations do take into account the order, r-combinations are independent of it. Therefore, permutation is considered to be an ordered combination.
